intro: Knautia integrifolia subsp. integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and entire. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
